sentence.value: Marianne Merchez (born 25 October 1960 in Uccle) is a Belgian doctor from the Catholic University of Louvain and a former European Space Agency astronaut.
sentence.annotated-sentence: [[Marianne Merchez|Marianne_Merchez]] (born 25 [[October 1960|October_1960]] in [[Uccle|Uccle]]) is a [[Belgian|Belgium]] doctor from [[the Catholic University|Catholic_university]] of Louvain and a former [[European Space Agency|European_Space_Agency]] [[astronaut|Astronaut]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: [[Marianne Merchez|Marianne_Merchez]] (born 25 October 1960 in [[Uccle|Uccle]]) is a [[Belgian|Belgium]] doctor from the Catholic University of Louvain and a former [[European Space Agency|European_Space_Agency]] [[astronaut|Astronaut]].

sentence.value: She is certified in aerospace medicine and in industrial medicine, and she is also a professional pilot (holds a Belgian Air Transport Pilot License from Civil Aviation School, former co-pilot Boeing 737).

sentence.value: Her predilection field is human relationships and communication and she integrates her training in brief systemic therapy and ericksonian hypnosis in daily personal and professional situations.
